 We are now a major step closer to returning Salmon to the river Aire for the first time in 150 years. https://t.co/kUqW6LwbQO

#DNAire #AireRiversTrust #EnvironmentAgency #Riverrestoration https://t.co/AQ2gaooeMg

tweets.text:
I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text:
The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg

urls.title: Beavers build first Exmoor dam in 400 years
urls.description: The National Trust says the dam in Somerset "might look modest, but it is incredibly special".

The River Lugg, in Herefordshire, one of the most beautiful and important rivers in the UK, has been intentionally destroyed over a stretch of approximately 1.5km with huge repercussions for wildlife downstream üëá 

https://t.co/NKDHJhVn3s

Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river

Major damage to River Lugg #Herefordshire . More here: https://t.co/anb9fNxIAx

‚ÄúThis is a crime against the environment.‚Äù Helen Stace, @HerefordshireWT

@CraigBennett3 @WildlifeTrusts @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/v4mzG75lp7

Melbourne Park defences have reached Storm Desmond level, better protecting 1200 homes and business in #Carlisle this winter

So what happens now? Local schools will be involved with planting a wildflower meadow to increase the biodiversity of Melbourne Park in Spring 2021 https://t.co/LeRONsvG6D

@Zoe_Parker @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids @kiergroup Hi @Zoe_Parker, the viewing gallery window has been installed at our Diglis fish pass, which is 5m deep. It's just outside of Worcester.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @bilgribs Makes sense, I reported one locally which I followed up. Obvious from the waffling conversation that the EA had been nowhere near it üò°üò°

Freshly installed ditch blocking raising the water table on Dartmoor, filling with water as fast as can be built. These ones designed to be leaky/overflow as flow too high for our normal peat covered ditch blocks. @dartmoornpa @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @moorsforfuture https://t.co/vwOQjioKM4

tweets.text:
@CraigBennett3 @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts Last night before #WildLive watched Rights of Nature discussion including Cormac Cullinan @SueWillman and @paulpowlesland
Interesting that NZ and Australia give legal status to mountains or rivers eg Yarra River. We need to consider earth jurisprudence
@CondelynneLynne @McKenzie6593 @EnvAgency @bilgribs During the same period they employed 10,514 staff.
@SevernUnlocked @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids @kiergroup How deep is it? And where is this?
@Feargal_Sharkey @McKenzie6593 @EnvAgency @bilgribs Staff at NE cut so assumed similar at EA ?
@CondelynneLynne @McKenzie6593 @EnvAgency @bilgribs 2018 - 19 EA spent ¬£1.395 billion, that's ¬£100 million up from 2015. Underfunded?

@Feargal_Sharkey @McKenzie6593 @EnvAgency @bilgribs Underfunded..?
